misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No detected misconception (correct parallel-array sorting mental model)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that sorting the scores array requires swapping the corresponding elements in the names array at the same time to keep the data aligned, and that after sorting ascending, the last element holds the maximum score.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: No gap detected: this matches Java’s execution model and the intended use of parallel arrays. The nested loops correctly implement a bubble sort and maintain alignment between arrays via paired swaps. Selecting index n-1 after ascending sort correctly yields the top student.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None (for valid inputs where N>0 and exactly N names and N scores are provided).
